definition: lit. to paint holding two brushes (idiom); fig. to work on two tasks at the same time/to attack one problem from two angles at the same time
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
variant of 管[guan3]
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Most transnational corporations engaged in food marketing have done both.
sentences.chinese: 大多数从事食品营销的跨国公司都在双管齐下。

sentences.english: Akula Subs and Apocalypse Tanks fire their load at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 阿库拉潜艇和天启坦克现在可以双管齐下。

sentences.english: Additionally, mass publicity and appropriate economic methods should be carried out alongside. (Translated by Jieping Hu.
sentences.chinese: 另外，公众宣传和适当的经济手段应该双管齐下。

sentences.english: Instead, the company is determined to double-down on its now aging strategy.
sentences.chinese: 他们反而决心双管齐下，延续他历来的战略。

sentences.english: Do both, but in any event, don't merely read the book.
sentences.chinese: 双管齐下，但是任何情况下，不要只是读书。

sentences.english: We believe in doing both, and learning while we do it.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持双管齐下，并在进行的过程中不断的学习。

sentences.english: South Korean banks have plans to help with both.
sentences.chinese: 没错，韩国多家银行就推出了这种双管齐下的服务。

definition: to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to develop simultaneously/to undertake concurrently
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom)/to kill two birds with one stone
half the work, twice the effect (idiom); the right approach saves effort and leads to better results/a stitch in time saves nine
lit. set up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); fig. instant effect/quick results
circumstances require action (idiom); absolutely necessary/imperative
to lay equal stress on/to pay equal attention to
won't work/will get (you) nowhere
to advance together
to complement one another (idiom)
the best policy/the best thing one can do in the circumstances
to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
to get sth done once and for all
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
